lead_paragraph: SILTON--Alice, passed away peacefully on May 29, 2016 at age 94. She was the beloved wife of 67 years of the late Robert Silton and is survived by her daughter Mary, her son Robert Silton Jr., and grandchildren John and Sarah. Born in Manhattan, Alice grew up at the Beresford with summers in Purchase, NY. She attended Mount Holyoke College and graduated from Barnard. Alice spent most of her adult life in Rye, NY as a homemaker, devoted wife and mother and as an avid volunteer that included many years working at White Plains Hospital. Alice was known for her down-to-earth, genuine manner, her loyalty to all that were close to her and especially for her knack at building a social network including friends from childhood, bridge club, country club, volunteering, and from her retirement community at The Osborn in Rye. Alice will be greatly missed by her children and grandchildren and by all that knew her. Memorial service to be held on Monday, June 13th at 11:00 am at Congregation Emanu-El of Westchester (2125 Westchester Ave. East, Rye, NY - corner of Kenilworth Road and Westchester Ave.). In her memory, donations may be made to White Plains Hospital at: Development Office, White Plains Hospital, 41 East Post Road, White Plains, NY 10601. 1/3
